DataElement.preferredName: Replacement Dental Implant Crown Fracture Reason Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no indicator related to the replacement of dental implant because of the portion of the tooth covered by enamel being fractured.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Replacement Dental Implant Crown Fracture Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the replacement of dental implant because of the portion of the tooth covered by enamel being fractured.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The act of removing one thing and putting another thing in its place.:Materials placed into (endosseous) or onto (subperiosteal) the jawbone; commonly used to support a crown, bridge, artificial tooth, stabilize a diseased tooth, or to use as anchorage in orthodontic therapy.

Concepts.definition: The act of removing one thing and putting another thing in its place.

Materials placed into (endosseous) or onto (subperiosteal) the jawbone; commonly used to support a crown, bridge, artificial tooth, stabilize a diseased tooth, or to use as anchorage in orthodontic therapy.

Property.preferredDefinition: The portion of the tooth covered by enamel.:A finding of traumatic injury to the bone in which the continuity of the bone is broken.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the tooth covered by enamel.
A finding of traumatic injury to the bone in which the continuity of the bone is broken.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
